intro: Metrosideros hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy rough shieldvine, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
